      static java.lang.String kmeans​(java.lang.String str, int k)
      This method first defines k random numbers as centroids of k clusters then finds the Euclidean distance between each datapoint and each centroid, the one closest to the dataset gets classified as belonging to that cluster then it finds the centroids of those clusters again and reclassifies the clusters again and again.

      • knearest

        public static java.lang.String knearest​(java.lang.String str,
                                        double[] arr,
                                        int k)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method receives a file with datasets with five features each belonging to a class either class 1 or class 2. If given a new dataset it can classify that as belonging to class 1 or class 2 based on the k nearest neighbors
        Parameters:
        str - - the path of the file passed to the method as a String
        arr - - the new dataset consisting of five features
        k - - number of nearest neighbors to be evaluated
        Returns:
        String - class 1 or class 2
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if file could not be opened

      • kmeans

        public static java.lang.String kmeans​(java.lang.String str,
                                      int k)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method first defines k random numbers as centroids of k clusters then finds the Euclidean distance between each datapoint and each centroid, the one closest to the dataset gets classified as belonging to that cluster then it finds the centroids of those clusters again and reclassifies the clusters again and again.
        Parameters:
        str - - The path of the file containing datasets as a String
        k - - the K clusters
        Returns:
        String the clusters and the number of datasets in each cluster
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if could not open file

      • centroidFinder

        private static double[][] centroidFinder​(java.util.Map<double[],​java.lang.Integer> datapoints,
                                         int k)
        Finds the centroid of a cluster if given clusters
        Parameters:
        datapoints - as Map of double arrays relating to a cluster
        k - : number of clusters
        Returns:
        the centroid of the clusters

      • classifier

        private static java.util.Map<double[],​java.lang.Integer> classifier​(double[][] dataset,
                                                                          double[][] centroid)
        classifer method classifies datasets based on centroids given
        Parameters:
        dataset - double matrix - matrix of datasets given ready to be classified
        centroid - double matrix - centroids
        Returns:
        A map that relates datasets to an int which is the number of cluster
